text: Arnór Ingvi Traustason (born 30 April 1993) is an Icelandic professional footballer who plays for Swedish club IFK Norrköping as a midfielder. He has also played for Knattspyrnudeild Keflavík, Sandnes Ulf, IFK Norrköping, SK Rapid Wien, A.E.K. Athens F.C., Malmö FF, and New England Revolution. He was called the most promising player of the 2013 Úrvalsdeild season. He also plays for the Iceland national football team. He was included in Iceland's UEFA Euro 2016 squad. On 22 June 2016, he scored against Austria at the 90th minute to win the match for Iceland and send them to the Round of 16. He won the Allsvenskan with IFK Norrköping in 2015. == References == == Other websites == *Arnór Ingvi Traustason profile at Soccerway *Arnór Ingvi Traustason at National-Football-Teams.com Category:1993 births Category:Living people Category:Icelandic footballers Category:UEFA Euro 2016 players
title: Arnór Ingvi Traustason
